TopicTitle: The unofficially official 0.24-Kerbapalooza Thread - Now extra #HYPETRAIN!

Articles.Content:
A little irritating but I can see why they take that stance. Keeps us from crying foul when the can't meet the deadline.

Edited July 7, 2014 by mastereryx

A little irritating but I can see why they take that stance. Keeps us from crying foul when the can't meet the deadline.

That might have happened so after that they stopped giving dates

That might have happened so after that they stopped giving dates

It's common policy really. Very few game developers give release dates for digital software. The only reason they can give them reliably for retail software is because it has to go to print.

It's common policy really. Very few game developers give release dates for digital software. The only reason they can give them reliably for retail software is because it has to go to print.

I suppose that makes sense but because of that policy we get threads full of speculation like this one. Sigh...
me waiting for 0.24

I'm sure it will come out... eventually...

F5... F5... F5... F5... *sigh* F5... F5... F5... F5...

looks like squad is working pretty hard on the experimentals...

http://steamdb.info/app/220200/history/

Oh, now that's nice link you have there

Shame it doesn't show a changelog.... man can dream....
And so it continues...

I suppose that makes sense but because of that policy we get threads full of speculation like this one. Sigh...

This is far better than thread full of acidic vitriol about how Squad promised and didn't deliver.

Actually we get those anyway, but there'd be more.
I think I know when it's coming, but I don't want to jinx it.

I think I know when it's coming, but I don't want to jinx it.

Must... F5... Faster...
My money is on after the Kerbin Cup is completed.
Scott Manley's budget cuts videos can be renamed as tutorials!
So according to the SteamDB link, the latest change is that...KSP now costs 0 Euros. I'm gonna go with "oops."

So according to the SteamDB link, the latest change is that...KSP now costs 0 Euros. I'm gonna go with "oops."

LOL, I noticed that too... "Buy" ALL THE COPIES!!!
Tuesday is usually a good day for video games.

Whoa, I did not expect that! Dwarf Fortress got its first new version almost 2 years today. We knew it was coming some time this week, but I was secretly hoping 0.24 of KSP would edge it out by a day or two.
I think there is no way they'd release it before the cup finishes especially since some of the top modders are in the competition..

Dwarf Fortress got its first new version almost 2 years today.
Thanks, bro!

My money is on after the Kerbin Cup is completed.

Probably this... Is that next week? Or the week after? Because I highly doubt it would be out this week, and even unlikely next week really... It'll be a short while yet people! Be patient!
It's double elimination this week, so that should leave only one forum team and one reddit team for the final round.

It's double elimination this week, so that should leave only one forum team and one reddit team for the final round.

Oooooo! *Tension rises*

Still not sure if it would be next week though... Feels like it wouldn't have been in experimentals for very long... :S

Feels like it wouldn't have been in experimentals for very long... :S

It's a huge patch bringing two major functionalities into the game: Budgets and Contracts.

No wonder they want to take more time testing it

It's a huge patch bringing two major functionalities into the game: Budgets and Contracts.

No wonder they want to take more time testing it

I agree it would really upset players if the game was suddenly not playable because of the new features. We've come to expect great things, at least I have anyway.
No matter how much they test it though, .25 (or maybe a .24.5 patch) will still need to balance it. I just hope people dont loose it and complain about it being unbalanced.
